results.title: Contemporary Scandinavia: common purposes, individual differences
results.creator_credit: Richard Kaplan, McGraw-Hill Films and Richard Kaplan Productions
results.brief_description: An overview of modern life in Denmark, Norway and Sweden. Describes their unique political organisation, stressing at the same time, national differences. Discusses the influence of both geography and modern technology on economic and social organisation, and Scandinavia’s role in world affairs. Includes a sequence on youth and education.

results.title: Contemporary painting 1950-1979
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye”.
Features “The Harbour from McMahon’s Point” - Looks at the work of Lloyd Rees. “Epiphany” - A powerful painting by Ian Fairweather. “Self portrait in the Studio” - by Brett Whiteley - “Truck and Trailer Heading into a City” - Examines the work of Jeffrey Smart. “Waterfall Polyptych” - by Fred Williams.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia

results.title: Contemporary Painting (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye V”.
CONTEMPORARY PAINTING (1950)is the seventh part in the renowned Australian Eye Series which traces the history of Australian Painting from colonial to contemporary times. The following artists and their work are examined in detail. Lloyd Rees - The Harbour from McMahon’s Point 1950 Ian Fairweather - Epiphany 1962 Brett Whiteley - Self Portrait in the Studio 1976 Jeffrey Smart - Truck and Trailer Heading into a City 1973 Fred Williams - Waterfall Polyptych 1979 Ten Contemporary Artists - The Creative Eye

results.title: Container port
results.creator_credit: Ian Woolfe, Edgar H. Anstey, James Ritchie, British Transport Films and IC Productions
results.brief_description: The story of the development of Tilbury into Britain’s biggest and newest container port, built and equipped to tranship standard maritime containers which are the key to a world-wide revolution in freight handling. Commentary by John Stockbridge.

results.title: Consumer protection
results.brief_description: A comparison of the buying habits of two American families - the Kings and the Whites. The Whites’ buying habits are based on the price and appearance of the product, while the Kings take advantage of consumer services offered in the USA, and thus make sure that they only buy the best.

results.title: Consumer education: maintaining an automobile
results.brief_description: Several young auto owners are shown dealing with the maintenance and repair requirements of their cars. The aim is to inform the viewer of the importance of proper automobile servicing and repairing and to advise how these may be accomplished with economy, emphasising the fact that proper servicing can make owning a car a pleasure.

results.title: Constructing reality: a film on film
results.creator_credit: David Altschul, Gilbert Altschul Productions and Journal Films
results.brief_description: The five key elements of film construction - film time, film space, perspective, rhythm and sound are discussed as we construct a film within a film about a sports car race. The film shows how the film-maker planned, photographed and edited sequences.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Altschul, Gilbert Altschul Productions and Journal Films

results.title: Constructing farm dams
results.brief_description: In some parts of Australia, farmers have to rely on seasonal rains for their annual water requirements, with the result that crops are often ruined due to low rainfall. In areas with a suitable clay sub-soil, earth dams can be constrcuted to conserve water to improve pastures and increase production. This film describes the principles and methods of dam construction recommended by the Water Conservation and Irrigation Commission of New South Wales.
